Tallahassee.Bellevue Plantation:
Bellevue Plantation was the U.S. home of Catherine Willis Gray Murat, located in Tallahassee, Florida. It was purchased in 1854 after Catherine's husband Prince Achille Murat (son of Joachim Murat, Napoleon's brother-in-law and King of Naples from 1808-1815) died in 1847.


== Plantation home ==
The home was named after the Hotel de Belle-Vue in Brussels, where Catherine and Achille had lived while in Europe.
